results.title: Importance of being frivolous
results.brief_description: A number of short amusing cartoons which show the advantages of an ordinary cheque account and the use of traveller’s cheques when overseas. Made for Barclay’s Bank, the cartoons have excellent commentaries.

results.title: The Importance of a good figure
results.brief_description: After an introduction to the computer, the film uses the processing of a railwayman’s pay to bring home the need for accuracy of computer input. Animation explains the technique which the computer uses to process staff pay. Examples of the wide use of computers show how more and more people are becoming involved with this need for accuracy.

results.title: Imperial sunset: an inquiry into the nature of the Commonwealth
results.brief_description: An ironic history, culled from much archive film footage preserved in London, the former heart of Empire, and attested by several surviving servants of Empire whose pride and faith in past missions is not without dignity despite the questionable aspects of empire-building. Commenting on the course of Empire are members of the Establishment, and young people of former colonies.

results.brief_description: An experimental animated film, dedicated to Elfriede and Oskar Fischinger, which involves the use of Avery labels to produce graphic designs. No dialogue, musical soundtrack.

results.title: Immunization
results.brief_description: The external symptoms of disease, and how disease affects the blood-stream, are shown; immunity may be obtained from a disease either by contracting it and surviving, thus gaining (usually) active immunization; or by vaccination, which provides passive immunity, is just as effective, and does not endanger life.
results.description: The external symptoms of disease, and how disease affects the blood-stream, are shown; immunity may be obtained from a disease either by contracting it and surviving, thus gaining (usually) active immunization; or by vaccination, which provides passive immunity, is just as effective, and does not endanger life.

results.title: Immortal image
results.brief_description: Examines the sculpture of Ukrainian-born artist Leo Mol and follows his technique, the lost wax method, as he creates a portrait in bronze. Includes comments by the artist.

results.title: Immigration
results.brief_description:
How the USA has been populated during the last two centuries. For many reasons people left the Old World to try their luck in the Americas - all have found a home in the USA during the past 200 years.
No credits available.

results.title: Imagination 10
results.creator_credit: Morton Goldscholl, Champion Papers and Morton Goldscholl Design
results.brief_description: This film pays tribute to the railroad and its contribution to America; discusses the type of life and work of the people who run the passenger and freight trains. Shows the aesthetic appeal of steel and steam and the beauty of nature along the right of way and is almost an abstract painting seen from a parlour car window, a montage of people. The film was prepared in conjunction with the publishing of a monograph on a variety of papers used by the railroads.

results.title: Images pour Debussy
results.brief_description: Scenes of rivers, streams, waves, fields are used in this visual interpretation of four Debussy works: “En Bateau”, “Reflets Dans L’Eau”, and the first and second “Arabesques”. Pianist: Jacques Ferrier.

results.title: Images pour Bach
results.brief_description: A series of abstract shapes and patterns are shown in synchronisation with two Bach compositions - Overture from the Suite for Orchestra No 5 in F major and Invention No 14 in D major are rearranged in modern electronic fashion. Colour and shape recur and vary according to the themes and variations in the musical structure.
